org.freezedry.persistence.writers

Class KeyValueWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.freezedry.persistence.writers.KeyValueWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PersistenceWriter

    public class KeyValueWriter
extends java.lang.Object
implements PersistenceWriter
    Writes the semantic model as a list of key-value pairs to the specified output stream. The writer uses a KeyValueBuilder that flattens the semantic model and returns a list of key-value pairs. The KeyValueBuilder can be specified, or a default one is created based on the supplied specifications for the KeyValueBuilder.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KeyValueWriter

        public KeyValueWriter(java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<?>,PersistenceRenderer> renderers,
              PersistenceRenderer arrayRenderer,
              java.lang.String keySeparator,
              java.lang.String keyValueSeparator)
        Constructs a basic key-value writer that uses the specified renderers and separator.
        Parameters:
        renderers - The mapping between the Class represented by an InfoNode and the PersistenceRenderer used to create the key-value pair.
        arrayRenderer - The PersistenceRenderer used to create key-value pairs for InfoNodes that represent an array.
        keySeparator - The separator between the flattened elements of the key
        keyValueSeparator - The separator between the key and the value
        See Also:
        AbstractKeyValueBuilder.getRenderer(Class)

    • Method Detail

      • setKeyElementSeparator

        public void setKeyElementSeparator(java.lang.String separator)
        The separator between the flattened key elements. For example, suppose that a Division has a List of Person objects, called people. The the key for a person's first name may be of the form: Division.people.Person[2].firstName, or Division:people:Person[2]:firstName. The "." and the ":" are separators.
        Parameters:
        separator - The separator

      • getKeyElementSeparator

        public java.lang.String getKeyElementSeparator()
        Returns:
        The separator between the flattened key elements. For example, suppose that a Division has a List of Person objects, called people. The the key for a person's first name may be of the form: Division.people.Person[2].firstName, or Division:people:Person[2]:firstName. The "." and the ":" are separators.

      • setKeyValueSeparator

        public void setKeyValueSeparator(java.lang.String separator)
        Parameters:
        separator - The separator between the key and the value. The default value is given by the KEY_VALUE_SEPARATOR which has a value of "=".

      • getKeyValueSeparator

        public java.lang.String getKeyValueSeparator()
        Returns:
        The separator between the key and the value.

        public void setBuilder(KeyValueBuilder builder)

      • write

        public void write(InfoNode rootNode,
         java.io.Writer output)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceWriter
        Writes the semantic model, as represented by the root InfoNode, to the PrintWriter output stream. The implementing class determines the format with which the semantic model is written. There should also be an equivalent PersistenceReader that can read the output into the semantic model.
        Specified by:
        write in interface PersistenceWriter
        Parameters:
        rootNode - The root InfoNode representing the semantic model of the object to be written.
        output - The Writer output stream to which to write the semantic model.
